ja43:1.1: An ascetic keeps a viper as a pet, despite being warned it will turn on him one day. | Similar to Aesop’s fable *The Farmer and the Viper*, this story is retold in modern songs and politics.
ja43:1.4: Normally _veḷuka_ means a “bamboo worker”, and as such is the name of a lower caste in later texts. Compare [sn42.19](), where a low-caste acrobat who engages in a dangerous balancing act with their student is protected by the fact that they listen to each others’ wise advice.
